meanings.sent1: The new broom was broomier than the old one.
meanings.sent2: The broomier brush swept the floor more efficiently.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her hair looked broomier than usual after a windy day.
meanings.sent4: The broomier clouds in the sky signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The broomier texture of the fabric made it ideal for cleaning purposes.

meanings.definition: Having more characteristics of a broom.
meanings.sent1: The broomier design of the brush made it easier to handle.
meanings.sent2: Her broomier attitude towards cleaning impressed her roommates.
meanings.sent3: The broomier appearance of the tree branches made them look like mini brooms.
meanings.sent4: The broomier smell of the cleaning products reminded her of her childhood home.
meanings.sent5: The broomier sound of the wind against the window resembled a sweeping motion.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a broom.
meanings.sent1: The broomier shape of the tool made it perfect for sweeping corners.
meanings.sent2: The broomier handle of the mop provided a better grip.
meanings.sent3: The broomier pattern on the carpet looked like tiny brooms scattered around.
meanings.sent4: Her broomier voice commanded attention in the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The broomier taste of the herbal tea reminded her of the scent of fresh brooms.
